title: HOW TO: DIY self watering system for plants or trees || Agrosuede

tasks.task: Implementing a self-watering technique using bottles and fabric
subtasks: Cutting the top off a bottle to create a water reservoir
Drilling a hole in the cap of another bottle for plant roots to access water
Positioning bottles in a way that allows water to be drawn up to the plants through evaporation and capillary action
Using fabric (e.g., cotton cloth) as a wicking material to transport water from the reservoir to the plant roots
Securing the fabric in place around the bottles to prevent water from spilling and to maintain the water level
Monitoring the moisture levels and adjusting the water reservoir as needed to ensure consistent plant hydration

tasks.task: Explaining the process of water movement in the self-watering system
subtasks: Describing how water moves from an area of high concentration to low concentration via capillary action
Discussing the role of evaporation in aiding the transport of water to the plants
Emphasizing the importance of maintaining the balance between moisture at the top and bottom of the fabric layer
Demonstrating how the system can rehydrate dry soil as the fabric wicks water upward

tasks.task: Encouraging viewers to experiment with the described self-watering technique
subtasks: Sharing personal experience and results of implementing the self-watering system in a planter
Advising viewers to adapt the technique to their own garden setups, considering factors like evaporation rate and plant water needs
Recommending the use of reusable materials (like cotton fabric) to make the system economical and environmentally friendly

tasks.task: Providing contact information for further engagement
subtasks: Sharing social media handles and contact numbers for viewers to request reactions or ask questions
Inviting viewers to like the Facebook page, follow on Twitter and Instagram, and subscribe to the YouTube channel for updates
